random.title: Did you know the Sun is over 300,000 times larger than Earth?
Did you know Venus is the hottest planet, with temperatures over 450°C?
Did you know a year on Mercury is just 88 days long?
Did you know Mars is known as the Red Planet because of its reddish appearance, caused by iron rust?
Did you know Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system?
Did you know Saturn has the most spectacular rings, made from ice and rock?
Did you know Uranus rotates on its side, unlike any other planet?
Did you know Neptune was the first planet discovered through mathematical predictions?
Did you know Pluto, now classified as a dwarf planet, was once considered the ninth planet?
Did you know the Milky Way galaxy is estimated to be 100,000 light years in diameter?
Did you know stars are gigantic balls of gas held together by gravity, with the closest to Earth being the Sun?
Did you know the Moon is Earth’s only natural satellite and affects tides on our planet?
Did you know a solar eclipse occurs when the Moon passes between Earth and the Sun?
Did you know a light year is the distance light travels in one year, about 9 trillion kilometers?
Did you know the universe is believed to be about 13.8 billion years old?
Did you know astronauts experience microgravity, making them feel weightless in space?
Did you know there are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all the Earth's beaches?
Did you know the first person to walk on the Moon was Neil Armstrong in 1969?
Did you know a day on Venus is longer than its year, taking 243 Earth days to rotate once?
Did you know the largest volcano in the solar system is on Mars, named Olympus Mons?
Did you know the asteroid belt lies between Mars and Jupiter, containing millions of rocky objects?
Did you know the Hubble Space Telescope orbits Earth, capturing stunning images of space?
Did you know black holes have such strong gravity that not even light can escape from them?
Did you know Saturn could float in water because it's mostly made of gas?
Did you know the first animal sent into space was a dog named Laika by the Soviet Union in 1957?
